title: Beenleigh: Chilling screams from couple as their car is stolen with their two children in the backseat
text:
CCTV footage has captured the horrifying moment a couple were carjacked while their two young children were still inside on Christmas Day.
The man believed to be responsible was seen running towards their Nissan Pathfinder at the Pacific Petroleum fuel station in Beenleigh, south of Brisbane, on Monday.
It is understood the man, dressed in black, pushed the mother out of the passenger seat as he slid behind the wheel and sped away at about 4.45pm.
Both parents tried to jump inside the car in a bid to stop the man from taking off with their two-year-old son and 10-month-old daughter still in the vehicle.
Their terrified screams could be heard just moments after they fell onto the ground.
CCTV footage shows the man believed to be responsible jumping behind the wheel of a Nissan Pathfinder at the Pacific Petroleum fuel station in Beenleigh, south of Brisbane
The man believed to be responsible was seen running towards their Nissan Pathfinder at the Pacific Petroleum fuel station in Beenleigh, south of Brisbane , on Monday
The children were unharmed and dropped at a service station in Cornubia before being reunited with their parents about 15 minutes later.
The father said his young son struggled to comprehend what had happened.
‘All he could say to me pretty much was that you know, “there was a bad man, and the bad man was angry”,’ he told 9News.
He said the children’s mother, 26, had been ‘distraught’ after losing sight of her kids.
‘I was just in shock more than anything else,’ he added.
Luckily, the children (pictured) were unharmed and dropped off at a nearby Woolworths
The man was spotted driving erratically on a highway just moments later.
Queensland Police say he had tried to carjack a woman’s Mazda at a 7-Eleven across the road just moments before the family’s car was stolen.
However, a female passer-by intervened and the man left empty-handed.
Both women sustained some minor injuries.
Investigations are continuing to locate the man and vehicle.
